definition[0]: a person or company that pays for a show, broadcast, sports event etc, especially in exchange for the right to advertise at that event
example[1]: Eastman Kodak is a major sponsor of the Olympics.
definition[1]: a person or company that supports someone by paying for their training, education, living costs etc
definition[2]: someone who agrees to give someone else money for a charity if they walk, run etc a particular distance
definition[3]: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law
definition[4]: someone who officially agrees to help someone else, or to be responsible for what they do
example[2]: You cannot get a work visa without an American sponsor.
definition[6]: to give money to a sports event, theatre, institution etc, especially in exchange for the right to advertise
example[3]: The competition was sponsored by British Airways.
definition[7]: to support someone by paying for their training, education, living costs etc
example[5]: The bank had offered to sponsor him at university.
definition[8]: to officially support a proposal for a new law
definition[9]: to agree to help someone or be responsible for what they do
definition[10]: to agree to give someone money for charity if they walk, run etc a particular distance
definition[11]: to give money to pay for a television programme, a sports or arts event, training etc, in exchange for advertising or to get public attention
example[6]: The insurance company sponsored the charityâ€™s first TV campaign.
example[7]: Some of the students are sponsored by engineering firms.
definition[12]: to officially support a proposal or suggestion
example[9]: The report was sponsored by 12 top companies.
definition[13]: a person or company that pays for a television programme, a sports or arts event, training etc, in exchange for advertising or to get public attention
example[10]: The exhibition organizers are now looking for sponsors.
definition[14]: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal or suggestion
